summary: Website for conducting an auction of 10 players between 2 bidders (each with a fixed budget of 10 cr), with a live audience view, an auction host role to conduct the auction, and live chat.
architectural_notes: Introduce roles: Host/Admin (can control auction) vs Audience/Spectator (read-only).
Support real-time updates to auction state for live viewing (push/streaming rather than manual refresh).
Add a live chat capability associated with an auction session.
known_issues: Bidding flow bug: when selecting a bidder (with a correct bid amount entered), app shows error message like "only 2 two bidders can bid" and blocks bidding.

existing_features.title: Build a frontend UI that allows users to: (1) configure the auction (enter 2 bidder names and 10 player names), (2) run the auction (select current player, enter bids, finalize sale), and (3) view results (rosters, remaining budgets, sold/unsold list, and sales history).
Connect frontend to the Motoko backend using React Query for data fetching/mutations, including loading, success, and error states for all auction actions.

Add a coherent visual theme and layout style across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) appropriate for a sports-player auction dashboard, avoiding a blue/purple primary palette.

Update the user-facing error message shown when a bid fails due to an invalid bidder so it is clear and grammatically correct in English (e.g., indicate that the selected bidder is not part of the auction).

Add an Audience (spectator) screen that lets viewers watch the auction live in a read-only mode, showing the current auctioned player, current highest bid and highest bidder, bidder remaining budgets, and the sold/unsold players list.
Make the Audience (spectator) screen update automatically to reflect the live auction state by polling the existing backend auction state query on an interval.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build an auction website for 10 players with 2 bidders, each starting with a 10 cr budget cap.
Create backend data models and persisted state for an auction of exactly 10 players and exactly 2 bidders, where each bidder starts with a fixed budget of 10 cr.
Implement backend methods to initialize/reset an auction with two bidder names and a list of 10 player names, and to fetch the complete current auction state for UI rendering.
Implement backend auction flow operations: start auctioning a specific unsold player, place a bid by one of the two bidders, and finalize (sell) the current player to the highest bidder.
Implement backend validation and invariants to enforce: only two bidders participate; total spend per bidder never exceeds 10 cr; and a player can be sold at most once.
Fix the backend bidding validation so that placing a bid accepts the two configured bidder names (entered during setup) instead of only accepting the hardcoded names "Bidder 1" and "Bidder 2".
Add a live audience/spectator mode so viewers can watch the auction state update in real time without conducting actions.
Add an auction host/admin role ("head of auction") who can conduct/control auction actions, with audience in read-only mode.
Add live chat for the auction (audience/participants can message during the live auction).

projectName: Two-bidder auction website for 10 players with 10 cr budgets
